uk.ac.aber.rcs.cs211.schedulersim

Interface Scheduler

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractScheduler, FirstComeFirstServed, HighestPriority, Lottery, ShortestJobFirst

    public interface Scheduler

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addNewJob(Job job)
      Add a new job onto the queue at the relevant position.
      Job[] getJobList()
      Get a list of the jobs currently on the queue in order.
      Job getNextJob()
      Get the next Job from the scheduler queue.
      void removeJob(Job job)
      Remove the Job from the queue.
      void reset()
      Clear the internal data structures.
      void returnJob(Job job)
      A job has had some processing done, and is now being returned to the queue.

    • Method Detail

      • getNextJob

        Job getNextJob()
               throws SchedulerException
        Get the next Job from the scheduler queue. This should just return the head of the queue, and not change the order in any way.
        Returns:
        the next job to execute.
        Throws:
        SchedulerException - if there are no jobs on the queue.

      • addNewJob

        void addNewJob(Job job)
               throws SchedulerException
        Add a new job onto the queue at the relevant position. This job must not already exist on the queue.
        Parameters:
        job - The new process job to be added.
        Throws:
        SchedulerException - if the job already exists on the queue.

      • returnJob

        void returnJob(Job job)
               throws SchedulerException
        A job has had some processing done, and is now being returned to the queue. This is where a job should be moved from the front of the queue to the new position it should be occupying.
        Parameters:
        job - A job pre-existing on the queue, being returned.
        Throws:
        SchedulerException - if the job does not exist on the queue.

      • removeJob

        void removeJob(Job job)
               throws SchedulerException
        Remove the Job from the queue. This may be because the job has finished, or because it has become blocked waiting for I/O
        Parameters:
        job - the job to remove.
        Throws:
        SchedulerException - if the job does not exist on the queue.

      • reset

        void reset()
        Clear the internal data structures.

      • getJobList

        Job[] getJobList()
        Get a list of the jobs currently on the queue in order.
        Returns:
        An array of jobs in order they are on the queue.
